file: The Strange Case Of Dr. Jekyll And Mr. Hyde.txt
question: What was the final note written by Dr. Faulkner found in the envelope addressed to Mr. Blackwood?
prediction:
The final note written by Dr. Faulkner was found in the envelope addressed to Mr. Blackwood and was as follows:

"I have left you this paper, for I know that you will come to read it and make of it what you will. You have come to know the story, the mystery, the awful truth, and I have no doubt that you have heard it in my own voice, as one hears a friend tell the truth. You have understood the events which have befallen us, and you have come to the same conclusion, the same sense of despair, the same acceptance of fate. And I have left you this paper, for I have gone beyond that sense of despair, for I have gone beyond the reach of my own guilt, for I have found peace. But I leave it to you, to decide what will become of me, to decide whether I shall be granted mercy, or whether I shall be left to suffer as I have done."

The note was sealed with Dr. Hawthorne's hand, and it signified that Dr. Hawthorne was dead, and it was up to Mr. Blackwood to decide what to do with the revelation.
ground_truth: It was marked as 'not to be opened till the death or disappearance of Dr. Dr. Hawthorne.'
